fields.name: Paladin
fields.description: Paladin are divine warriors of the world. They are stalwart in faith and devotion to their deity that they have chosen. Well trained, paladins are armed with both their skills and their deities divine powers

fields.name: Barbarian
fields.description: Rage consumes you in battle. You delight in wreaking havoc and using powerful weapons to carve through your enemies, relying on astonishing durability without needing complicated techniques or rigid training. Your rages draw upon a vicious instinct, which you might associate with an animal, a spirit, or some part of yourself. To many barbarians, brute force is a hammer and every problem looks like a nail, whereas others try to hold back the storm of emotions inside them and release their rage only when it matters most.

fields.name: Druid
fields.description: Druids revere nature above all, gaining their spells and other magical powers either from the force of nature itself or from a nature deity. Many druids pursue a mystic spirituality of transcendent union with nature rather than devotion to a divine entity, while others serve gods of wild nature, animals, or elemental forces.

fields.name: Warlock
fields.description: A warlock is defined by a pact with an otherworldly being. Sometimes the relationship between warlock and patron is like that of a cleric and a deity, though the beings that serve as patrons for warlocks are not gods. A warlock might lead a cult dedicated to a demon prince, an archdevil, or an utterly alien entity—beings not typically served by clerics. More often, though, the arrangement is similar to that between a master and an apprentice. The warlock learns and grows in power, at the cost of occasional services performed on the patron’s behalf.

fields.name: Sorcerer
fields.description: You didn't choose to become a spellcaster—you were born one. There's magic in your blood. Perhaps a divine influence blessed one of your ancestors, a forebear communed with an ancient, primordial entity, or a powerful occult ritual performed long ago influenced your lineage. Self-reflection and study allow you to refine your inherent magical skills and unlock new, more powerful abilities. The power in your blood carries a risk, however, and you constantly face the choice of whether you'll rise to become a master spellcaster or fall into destruction.

fields.name: Rogue
fields.description: You are skilled and opportunistic. Using your sharp wits and quick reactions, you take advantage of your opponents’ missteps and strike where it hurts most. You play a dangerous game, seeking thrills and testing your skills, and likely don’t care much for any laws that happen to get in your way. While the path of every rogue is unique and riddled with danger, the one thing you all share in common is the breadth and depth of your skills.

fields.name: Ranger
fields.description: Far from bustling cities, amid the trees of trackless forests and across wide plains, Rangers keep their unending watch in the wilderness. Rangers learn to track their quarry as a predator does, moving stealthily through the wilds and hiding themselves in brush and rubble. Some have deep bond with nature and are able to harvest its power, others are expert survivors and in weapons

fields.name: Bard
fields.description: Invoking magic through music, dance, and verse, Bards are expert at inspiring others, soothing hurts, disheartening foes, and creating illusions. Bards believe the multiverse was spoken into existence and that remnants of its Words of Creation still resound and glimmer on every plane of existence. Bardic magic attempts to harness those words, which transcend any language.

fields.name: Pioneer
fields.description: You are man who pushes boundaries in the fields of science, magic or some fusion of both. Aiming to push it to it’s very limits.

fields.name: Monk
fields.description: Monks use rigorous combat training and mental discipline to align themselves with the multiverse and focus their internal reservoirs of power. Different Monks conceptualize this power in various ways: as breath, energy, life force, essence, or self, for example. Whether channeled as a striking display of martial prowess or as a subtler manifestation of defense and speed, this power infuses all that a Monk does.

fields.name: Cleric
fields.description: Clerics draw power from the realms of the gods and harness it to work miracles. Blessed by a deity, a pantheon, or another immortal entity, a Cleric can reach out to the divine magic of the Outer Planes—where gods dwell—and channel it to bolster people and battle foes.

fields.name: Fortress Sentinel
fields.description: These warriors are often guardians of critical places or people, experts at holding the lines against hordes of enemies without fear. They are the stalwart bulwarks of any battle

fields.name: Wildfire
fields.description: Druids of the Wildfire embody the necessity that destruction is necessity to creation. They are the

fields.name: Storm
fields.description: Storm druids are those who keep the air clean, keeping the force of nature of the weather in check.

fields.name: Moon
fields.description: Moon druids are the ruthless guardians of nature’s order. Through the cycles of the moon and powers

fields.name: Beastial
fields.description: Beastial druids have formed an uncanny relationship with beasts, able to channel great animalistic f

fields.name: Deepwood
fields.description: Deepwood druids are one of the druids who have made a great connection to the tree spirits of the de

fields.name: Fey
fields.description: Fey druids are whimsical, unpredictable, and deeply connected to the magic of the Feywild. They embo

fields.name: Untamed
fields.description: Untamed druids are an enigma to many, and even consisred outcast in some societies. These druids hav

fields.name: Cleansing
fields.description: The cleansing paladin is dedicated to purging corruption. They seek to cleanse forces, entities, gro

fields.name: Crusader
fields.description: The crusader is a paladin on a holy mission to advance or defend their ideals. They often impose the

fields.name: Protector
fields.description: A protector paladin seeks to defend the weak and ensure the safety of key or holy individuals. They

fields.name: Vengence
fields.description: A vengeance paladin pursues retribution against those who have wronged their domain, god, or people.

fields.name: Redemption
fields.description: A redemption paladin is dedicated to inspiring others toward redemption. They seek to turn enemies a

fields.name: Obedience
fields.description: An obedience paladin upholds the absolute authority of divine law. They are loyal enforcers of their

fields.name: Liberation
fields.description: A liberation paladin is a champion of freedom and autonomy. They fight to protect the ideals of libe

fields.name: Glory
fields.description: You are devoted to achieve glory through deeds of heroism

fields.name: Arcane
fields.description: Arcane domain Clerics are devoted to the ideals of magic and the gods devoted or supportive to it

fields.name: Darkness
fields.description: Embracers of night and shadows, Darkness Domain clerics wield necrotic power and control the unseen

fields.name: Destruction
fields.description: Masters of thunderous devastation, Destruction Domain clerics infuse their melee strikes with escala

fields.name: Earth
fields.description: Anchored to elemental earth, Earth Domain clerics shape stone and soil. They speak Primordial, shiel

fields.name: Fate
fields.description: Tide-turners of destiny, Fate Domain clerics glimpse omens and manipulate chance. They divinely scry

fields.name: Forge
fields.description: Artisan paragons, Forge Domain clerics infuse metal with magic. They create or enhance weapons and a

fields.name: Knowledge
fields.description: Lore masters, Knowledge Domain clerics unravel secrets and empower allies. They learn extra language

fields.name: Life
fields.description: Healers of unparalleled potency, Life Domain clerics excel in restorative magic. They channel Divini

fields.name: Light
fields.description: Champions of radiance, Light Domain clerics wield blinding power to dispel darkness and strike foes.

fields.name: Order
fields.description: Enforcers of divine law, Order Domain clerics command obedience and structure. They resist compulsio

fields.name: Passion
fields.description: Masters of charisma and allure, Passion Domain clerics enthrall and inspire. They wield charming can

fields.name: Peace
fields.description: Bastions of tranquility, Peace Domain clerics forge bonds that bolster and protect. They grant alli

fields.name: Shadow
fields.description: Weavers of light and darkness, Shadow Domain clerics retaliate in kind. They reflect radiant and nec

fields.name: Trickery
fields.description: Illusionists of divine misdirection, Trickery Domain clerics craft duplicates and vanish. They bles

fields.name: War
fields.description: Avatars of righteous combat, War Domain clerics blend holy might with martial skill. They wield wisd

fields.name: Warpriest
fields.description: You have trained in the more militant doctrine of your church, focusing on both spells and battle.

fields.name: Cloistered
fields.description: You are a cleric of the cloth, focusing on divine magic and your connection to your deity’s domains.

fields.name: Beastial
fields.description: You shed all civilized restraint and embrace your primal nature. Your senses sharpen to an animal’s

fields.name: Berserker
fields.description: A blaze of fury ignites within you, driving you beyond mortal limits. You become an unstoppable tem

fields.name: Zealot
fields.description: Your rage is an act of sacred devotion, each strike echoing divine mandate. You blaze with holy fer

fields.name: Wild Magic
fields.description: Arcane chaos surges through your veins, your rage warping reality in unpredictable bursts. One mome

fields.name: Ancestral Guardian
fields.description: Ancestral spirits rise when you rage, forming ethereal sentinels that shield your comrades and torm

fields.name: Giant
fields.description: You awaken the blood of titans, growing into a colossus on the battlefield. Wielding gargantuan wea

fields.name: Nature Warden
fields.description: You are a ranger bound to nature, giving you the ability to cast spells

fields.name: Strider
fields.description: Striders are the master of the wilderness. Without any inherent magical skill, they have raw grit an

fields.name: Hunter
fields.description: Hunters rangers are experts in tracking and combat, they often track and hunt beast

fields.name: Fey Wanderer
fields.description: A fey mystique surrounds you, thanks to the boon of an archfey, the shining fruit you ate from a talking tree, the magic spring you swam in, or some other auspicious event. However you acquired your fey magic, you are now a Fey Wanderer, a ranger who represents both the mortal and the fey realms. As you wander the multiverse, your joyful laughter brightens the hearts of the downtrodden, and your martial prowess strikes terror in your foes, for great is the mirth of the fey and dreadful is their fury.

fields.name: Gloomstalker
fields.description: Gloom stalkers are at home in the darkest places: deep under the earth, in gloomy alleyways, in primeval forests, and wherever else the light dims. Most folk enter such places with trepidation, but a gloom stalker ventures boldly into the darkness, seeking to ambush threats before they can reach the broader world. Such rangers are often found in the Underdark, but they will go any place where evil lurks in the shadows.

fields.name: Beast Master
fields.description: Beast Masters have creatures they have bonded with and work together in perfect harmony

fields.name: Lore
fields.description: Weavers of knowledge and cunning, Lore bards delve into ancient secrets, using song and satire to uncover truths and undermine foes. Their performances shift fate through whispered arcana and clever quips, guiding allies with wisdom plucked from every corner of the world.

fields.name: Swords
fields.description: Dancing with blade and melody, Swords bards merge martial artistry and song. Each flourish disorients opponents as razor-sharp harmonies echo through steel strikes. Their elegant assaults inspire comrades, turning every duel into a performance of deadly grace and rhythmic combat poetry.

fields.name: Dancer
fields.description: Mesmerizing audiences and battlefields alike, Dancer bards channel fluid motion to beguile enemies and embolden allies. Their hypnotic routines weave illusion and sound, surrounding friends with protective rhythms while foes falter under the spellbinding cadence of their art.

fields.name: Maestro
fields.description: Conductors of war’s symphony, Maestro bards wield charisma as a baton. They orchestrate each clash with commanding gestures, emboldening troops and synchronizing strikes with precision. Their resonant leadership transforms chaotic battle into a choreographed opus of victory.

fields.name: Demon
fields.description: You channel abyssal might, your magic crackling with chaotic force. Bound to a Sogomere lord, you wield destructive power at the cost of your own stability, each dark pact whispering temptation and unleashing unpredictable fury.

fields.name: Devil
fields.description: Your soul is tethered to an infernal architect of order. Through calculated bargains and burning oaths, you command hellfire and coercive guile, enforcing infernal law with razor-sharp contracts and radiant torment.

fields.name: Fey
fields.description: You dance on the edge of whim and wonder, drawing on capricious nature spirits. Your spells warp reality with playful tricks, illusions, and enchanted movements, leaving foes confounded and allies beguiled by your otherworldly charm.

fields.name: Celestial
fields.description: An emissary of light empowers your every word. You channel radiant grace to heal wounds and smite darkness, serving as your patron’s living beacon—uplifting allies with holy fervor and blasting corruption with pure, shining magic.

fields.name: Great Old One
fields.description: You commune with incomprehensible entities beyond reality’s veil. Your magic warps minds and fractures sanity, summoning cosmic dread to unravel foes’ thoughts while you whisper forbidden secrets no mortal was meant to hear.

fields.name: Undead
fields.description: Death’s whisper guides your art. You bend necrotic energies to drain life and bind spirits, standing between the living and the grave as a conduit of uncanny resilience and spectral command.

fields.name: Bladebound
fields.description: Your patron’s essence infuses your weapon, making every strike a living spell. Steel and sorcery entwine as you summon and empower a mystical blade that cleaves through mortal flesh and arcane wards alike.

fields.name: Tomebound
fields.description: A sentient grimoire of forgotten lore rests in your hand. You draw upon its eldritch pages to cast uncanny cantrips and secret rituals, wielding knowledge as a weapon to manipulate fate and smite your foes.

fields.name: Contract Bound
fields.description: Your very being is a living treaty. With each boon drawn, you trade favors in words etched by blood and ink, weaving binding clauses that grant formidable gifts—and demand dire debts in return.

fields.name: Herald
fields.description: An otherworldly companion answers your summons. Whether celestial envoy or fiendish wraith, your herald fights by your side, reinforcing your power and embodying your patron’s will through its supernatural presence.

fields.name: Totem
fields.description: A sacred relic holds your patron’s spirit. As long as your totem stands, its primal force surrounds you, granting elemental resonance and spiritual protection that pulses through you like an ancient heartbeat.

fields.name: Soul
fields.description: Your soul itself is the conduit. Manifesting spectral echoes or eldritch forms, you transform mid-combat into your patron’s avatar, reshaping your own essence into a living embodiment of its arcane dominion.

fields.name: Assassin
fields.description: You have chosen the life of an assassin, specializing in the art of killing people with deadly precision wherever they may be.

fields.name: Agent
fields.description: You are an agent, often spies, investigators and forward reconnaissance elements of governments or organisations. You find yourself at home in the world of espionage. For you excel in gathering information through reconnaissance, subterfuge and espionage. Likewise, you may specialise in countering such acts.

fields.name: Thief
fields.description: You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cutpurses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype, but so do rogues who prefer to think of themselves as professional treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages,

fields.name: Mastermind
fields.description: Your focus is on people and on the influence and secrets they have. Many crime lords, courtiers, and schemers follow this archetype, leading lives of intrigue. Words are your weapons as often as knives or poison, and secrets and favors are some of your favorite treasures.

fields.name: Scoundrel
fields.description: You use fast-talking, flattery, and a silver tongue to avoid danger and escape tricky situations. You might be a grifter or con artist, or you might use your skills in certain reputable professions, like a barrister or diplomat

fields.name: Swashbucker
fields.description: You focus your training on the art of the blade, relying on speed, elegance, and charm in equal parts. While some warriors are brutes clad in heavy armor, your method of fighting looks almost like a performance. Pirates and those who fight for challenge typically belong to this archetype

fields.name: Abjuration
fields.description: Masters of magical defense, you weave impenetrable wards and counter enemy spells. Your arcane runes stand as unyielding bulwarks, shielding allies from harm and turning hostile magic back upon its caster.

fields.name: Battle Mage
fields.description: You meld sword and sorcery into a single devastating art. In the thick of combat you strike with blade and spell in seamless harmony, overwhelming foes with relentless, rhythm-driven ferocity.

fields.name: Biomancy
fields.description: You command life’s energies to heal and transform. Whether mending grievous wounds, bolstering flesh, or twisting vitality, your touch reshapes living matter into a potent blend of restorative and enhancing magic.

fields.name: Chronology
fields.description: Time itself bends to your will. You glimpse futures, rewind moments, and hasten or halt the flow of events, granting foresight or trapping enemies in temporal stasis with uncanny precision.

fields.name: Conjuration
fields.description: Summoner and battlefield architect, you call creatures and objects into being. Your magic reshapes the very arena of war—erecting walls, hurling weapons, or unleashing loyal allies from thin air.

fields.name: Divination
fields.description: Seers of the arcane, you pierce the veil of fate. Through augury and uncanny insight, you foresee outcomes, glean hidden truths, and guide your companions with prophetic certainty.

fields.name: Elemental Magic
fields.description: Your mastery over nature’s raw energies lets you unleash cataclysmic storms or forge protective elemental shields.

fields.name: Enchantment
fields.description: Weavers of the mind, you beguile and manipulate through subtle glamour. Your whispered words and entrancing melodies turn foes into friends or puppets, bending wills with effortless elegance.

fields.name: Evocation
fields.description: Your spells crackle with raw destructive power. Whether blasting foes with torrents of flame, bolts of lightning, or explosive force, your precise control makes your magic both deadly and efficient.

fields.name: Illusion
fields.description: Artisans of deception, you craft reality-bending phantasms. From silent mirages to thunderous phantasmal armies, your illusions confound the senses, leaving enemies lost in a dream you alone command.

fields.name: Necromancy
fields.description: You stand at the threshold of life and death. Channeling dark energies, you raise the fallen, siphon vitality, and command legions of undead as you reshape mortality itself.

fields.name: Psionics
fields.description: Your mind is your greatest weapon. With focused will you move objects, probe thoughts, and unleash psychic assaults that fracture both resolve and reality.

fields.name: Order of Scribes
fields.description: Your sentient spellbook is your partner in arcane study. Together you adapt and innovate spells on the fly, exploiting every page’s hidden secrets to outthink any challenge.

fields.name: War Magic
fields.description: You are the ultimate combat spellcaster. Blending offense and defense, your magic deflects incoming attacks even as it strikes back, forging a relentless dance of shield and strike.

fields.name: Strength
fields.description: Monks of raw physical mastery, channeling ki into unbreakable fortitude and devastating strikes. They shrug off harm, shatter defenses with mighty fists, and harness bodily resilience to dominate foes in close combat, turning every punch into an earth-shaking blow.

fields.name: Alacrity
fields.description: Swift practitioners weaving ki into blistering motion and reflexive grace. They blur across the battlefield, dodging blows with uncanny speed, striking in lightning-quick flurries, and weaving between enemies before opponents can even react.

fields.name: Spirit
fields.description: Monks attuned to inner energy, channeling ki into ethereal defense and healing. They sustain allies with soothing pulses, phase through danger with spectral resilience, and unleash spiritual strikes that meld corporeal prowess with mystical power.

fields.name: Boxing
fields.description: Masters of rhythmic strikes and fluid footwork, Boxing monks synchronize breath and motion into a relentless dance of punches.

fields.name: Wrestler
fields.description: Colossal grapplers who blend iron grip and tactical holds. Wrestler monks seize control of the battlefield by locking foes in crushing clinches, slamming them prone, and safeguarding allies through expert repositioning.

fields.name: Takindori
fields.description: A hybrid of speed and power, Takindori unites kicking prowess with swift acrobatics. Their rear-leg stance channels explosive leg strikes that crack bones and launch enemies skyward, while seamless movement allows them to dart among opponents like a whirlwind of disciplined fury.

fields.name: Ki'nandi
fields.description: Flowing like wind and lightning, Ki’nandi monks harness storm-like ki bursts. They gain “Nandi” points to fuel uncanny counters, armor-piercing knuckle strikes, and telegraphed sidesteps. Their style emphasizes swift, precise hits that crack armor and shatter defenses with electric grace.

fields.name: Judin
fields.description: Rooted in traditional throws, Judin blends judo-inspired takedowns with lightning-fast strikes. They pivot and reap to send foes crashing down, then lock limbs with bone-twisting holds. Every throw and lock is a study in balance, momentum, and controlled devastation.

fields.name: Wu Chun
fields.description: Guardians of steadfast defense, Wu Chun monks harden their bodies into unyielding bulwarks. Their “sticky hands” stance absorbs blows, then channels ki into drilling punches that break through parries. They excel at locking down enemies, shattering defenses with unrelenting precision.

fields.name: Long Hu
fields.description: Draconic in ferocity and grace, Long Hu (“Dragon Tiger”) monks embody tiger-like power and dragon-like speed. They leap skyward in soaring assaults, whip fierce kicks that rend armor, and counter with snatching strikes, weaving a feral storm of martial prowess.

fields.name: Slyv’kali
fields.description: Shadow-dwellers flowing between form and illusion. Slyv’kali monks vanish in a blur, strike twice before sight catches up, and leave afterimages that confound attackers. Their silent, ghost-like assaults bleed foes dry with swift, stealth-infused precision.

fields.name: Quinali
fields.description: Water-shaped fighters who bend and flow around danger. Quinali monks redirect attacks like rippling currents, glide through difficult terrain, and unleash “ebb and flow” strikes that carry enemies off balance. Their style is a seamless blend of evasive dance and fluid offense.

fields.name: Mual'Ti
fields.description: Titans among monks, Mual’Ti channel earth’s immovable resilience. Their blows shatter shields, their clinches trap like molten iron, and their “titan’s stance” renders them immovable anchors. They master raw fortitude and bone-crushing might in every strike.

fields.name: Wujing
fields.description: Blade dancers who entwine martial grace with weapon mastery. Wujing monks bond with dao or spear as living extensions of their ki, unleashing sweeping arcs and precise thrusts. Their style is a flowing continuum of blade and body, cutting through defenses like wind.

fields.name: Kenshei
fields.description: Experts of instantaneous strikes and unerring parry. Kenshei monks draw and sheathe with blade-swift reflexes, turning every moment into a lethal iai-style slash. Their focused calm lets them deflect incoming threats while delivering critical precision cuts.

fields.name: Four Elements
fields.description: Embodiments of elemental will, these monks ignite fire, sculpt earth, ride winds, or flow like water. They channel ki into blasts of flame, tremors of stone, gales of air, or surges of water, warping terrain and raining elemental judgment upon opponents.

fields.name: Astral Arms
fields.description: Spirit warriors who materialize spectral limbs. Astral Arms monks manifest force-fist gauntlets of pure ki, extending their reach and striking ethereal fascia. Their otherworldly appendages phase through armor, unleash force blasts, and blend corporeal prowess with astral power.

fields.name: Meditation
fields.description: Ascetics of inner calm who transform stillness into power. Meditation monks harness ki through deep focus, weaving mind-over-matter defenses and subtle mental strikes. Their presence steeps the battlefield in tranquility, bending clash and chaos to serene precision.

fields.name: Long Death
fields.description: Harbingers of mortality who wield death’s edge. Long Death monks siphon life with every blow, curse foes with necrotic pulses, and defy death through heart-stopping touches. They tread the threshold between life and death, turning mortality into their weapon.

fields.name: Sun Soul
fields.description: Radiant bearers of dawn’s fire, Sun Soul monks channel solar ki into blinding bolts and searing flurries. Their bodies glow like suns, casting light into darkness and forging allies in the brilliance of their burning hands.

fields.name: Celestial Calling
fields.description: Spiritual heralds echoing celestial grace. Celestial Calling monks invoke sacred chants and radiant strikes, purging fear and bolstering comrades with divine light. Their every motion resonates with holy energy, laying waste to corruption and imbuing allies with heavenly vigor.

fields.name: Black Powder
fields.description: A daring marksman-engineer, the Black-Powder Master blends martial prowess with combustible ingenuity. They customize firearms and craft bespoke explosives—grenades, breaching charges, and tripwire mines—turning every shot into a controlled detonation. On the battlefield, their arsenal is equal parts precision and pandemonium.

fields.name: Banneret
fields.description: Clad in colors and symbols of their order, the Banneret plants their standard in the heart of battle. Their presence turns the tide—bolstering allies’ courage, forging unbreakable formations, and wreathed in rallying cries that steel hearts against despair.

fields.name: Battle Stratergist
fields.description: A master of the chessboard that is war, the Battle Strategist reads the battlefield like an open map. With deft commands and rousing signals, they position allies for advantage, exploit enemy weaknesses, and turn the clash of steel into a symphony of coordinated strikes.

fields.name: Cavaliar
fields.description: A mounted noble whose steed and rider become a single striking force. Cavaliers thunder into battle on horseback, lancing foes with momentum and expert horsemanship. They are knight-errants of battlefield romance, delivering crushing charges and deftly parrying while aloft in the saddle.

fields.name: Duelist
fields.description: The blade-flourishing fencer who thrives on one-on-one challenges. Duelists dance along the edge of blades, parrying with uncanny timing and riposting with lethal precision. Their art is personal honor, winning combat not by sheer force but by outthinking and outmaneuvering a single adversary.

fields.name: Raider
fields.description: The Raider is the quintessential skirmisher: a lightning-fast harasser who thrives on surprise, mobility, and sowing chaos. Raiding parties follow their lead into enemy territory and vanish like ghosts—striking hard, disappearing, and leaving confusion in their wake.

fields.name: Marksmen
fields.description: The Marksman is a master of ranged warfare: a disciplined sharpshooter who controls the battlefield from afar, picking off high-value targets and weaving deadly geometry with every shot.

fields.name: Weapon Master
fields.description: You are an arms expert who wields any weapon as an extension of their will, flowing seamlessly between swords, axes, polearms, and more.

fields.name: Second Wind
fields.description:
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use an action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

fields.name: Trackless Journey
fields.description: When you move through natural terrains, you are hard to track. You always gain the benefits of the Cover Tracks action in such terrains, without moving at half your Speed.

fields.name: Devoted Blessing
fields.description:
At 1st level you gain the ability to invoke divine power. You gain the amount of devoted blessing points equal to your paladin level + your charisma modifier. 

You regain your Paladin spellcasting proficiency tier score per shot rest in points, or all in long rest.

fields.name: Smite
fields.description: You imbue your weapon with divine powers. The next melee weapon attack does <Your favored domain damage type>D10 damage. You can increase the amount of dice rolled by spending additional devoted points to a max of your charisma modifier + your level/4

fields.name: Lay on hands
fields.description:
Lay on hands.
Your hands become infused with powerful vitality, capable of healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch. 


Willing Living Creature The target regains Hit Points equal to <spent devoted points>*<Your Paladin spellcasting proficiency tier>. To a max of <half your level If the target is someone other than yourself, it gains a +1 to fortitude save until
Undead Creature The target takes <spent devoted points>*<Your Paladin spellcasting proficiency tier> with a basic Fortitude save.

fields.name: Channel Divinity
fields.description:
At 2nd level you can channel a miniscule fraction of your god's power. What it is you can choose from the following below. Once you choose you cannot change. You gain another channel divinity from your domain

You have channel divinity equal to your Cleric spellcasting proficiency tier. Trained = 1, Expert = 2, Master = 3, Legendary = 4. You regain 1 use per short rest or all use at long rest.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
fields.description: As 2 actions, you unleash a wave of holy energy that repelsrepells the dead. Every creature with the undead tag must make a will saving throw. On a failure they are considered terrified even if they are immune to terror.

fields.name: Channel Divinity Divine Stabilization
fields.description: As an action, touch an ally who is dying. You immediately reduce them to dying 0 and wounded 0 and stabilize them.

fields.name: Channel Divinity:  God’s Courage
fields.description: You can use this as a reaction or an action. You automatically pass any saving throws made to frighten or terrify you for the next minute.

fields.name: Divine Intervention
fields.description:
For it to succeed, you must roll a D100. You get a value of (cleric level + cleric spellcasting) x 2. Your must roll above 100 - your value. If you are in a situation where you are fighting natural enemies of your god, or in an eventa event which threatens your god, you gain advantage on your roll. 

The DM determines what sort of assistanceassiatance it may give. A high level spell from a relevant origin may suffice. The DM should exerciseexcercise creative freedom in choosingchosing what aid.

fields.name: Warpriest First Doctrine
fields.description: You have expert proficiency in Fortitude saves.

fields.name: Warpriest Second Doctrine
fields.description: You’re trained in martial weapons.

fields.name: Warpriest Third Doctrine
fields.description: You gain expert proficiency with martial weapons, simple weapons, and unarmed attacks

fields.name: Warpriest Third Doctrine
fields.description: You gain a martial mastery

fields.name: Warpriest Fourth Doctrine
fields.description: Your proficiency ranks for the Cleric Spellcasting statistics increase to expert.

fields.name: Warpriest Fourth Doctrine - Divine Strike
fields.description: You are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal 1d8 of your domain favored damage to that creature

fields.name: Warpriest Final Doctrine
fields.description: You gain master proficiency with weapons

fields.name: Warpriest Final Doctrine
fields.description: You gain master proficiency with Cleric Spellcasting

fields.name: Cloistered First Doctrine
fields.description: you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to fuel your spells. As an action, you touch your holy symbol, utter a prayer, and regain one expended spell slot, the level of which can be no higher than half your highest levelled spell(round down). The number of times you can use this feature is based on the level you've reached in this class: 2nd level, once; 6th level, twice; and 18th level, thrice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest

fields.name: Cloistered Second Doctrine
fields.description: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

fields.name: Cloistered Third Doctrine
fields.description: Your proficiency ranks for Cleric Spellcasting increase to expert.

fields.name: Cloistered Fourth Doctrine
fields.description: When you do damage with a cleric cantrip, add your wisdom modifier to the damage

fields.name: Cloistered Fifth Doctrine
fields.description: Your proficiency ranks for the Cleric Spellcasting statistics increase to master.

fields.name: Cloistered Final Doctrine
fields.description: Your proficiency ranks for the Cleric Spellcasting statistics increase to legendary.

fields.name: Clerid Domain
fields.description: You choose a domain shaped by your choice of Deity and the gifts they grant you.

fields.name: Arcane Repository
fields.description: You can learn 1 spell that has the arcane tag at cleric level 3,6,9,12,15 and 18 and add it to your known spells and count as cleric spells.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Arcane Intervention
fields.description: You can cast a spell you have prepared with the arcane tag without using any spell slot. The spell must be of a level equal or lower than your highest spell.

fields.name: Arcane Abjuration
fields.description: When you heal an ally, you give them a +1 bonus to their next saving throw against magic for the next minute

fields.name: Arcane Invoker
fields.description: You can cast a spell you have not prepared.  You can do this once per short or long rest.

fields.name: Spell Breaker
fields.description: When you target an ally or an enemy with a spell you can spend an action to end a spell or magical effect on them provided it is below half your highest level spell(rounded down) - 1.

fields.name: Mystic Beacon
fields.description: Your spells are always upcasted by one level higher than normal

fields.name: Night Sight
fields.description: You gain 120 feet of darkvision, and can see 20 feet of magical darkvision

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Unending Darkness
fields.description: As a channel divinity you can create a 30x30 feet area of complete darkness. You however can see through this darkness.  You can use an action to grant an ally the ability to see through darkness.

fields.name: Ally of Darkness
fields.description: When attacking a creature in the dark or when attacking from darkness you do extra damage against them equal to half your cleric level (round up) in necrotic damage.

fields.name: Warding Shadow
fields.description: You can spend an action to prepare this ability. When targetedtargetted by a ranged attack, you may expend a reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack.

fields.name: Enveloped in Darkness
fields.description: As a minute ritual, you create darkness in a 5 feet radius enveloping you. You can turn it off at will.

fields.name: The Void
fields.description:
Anytime a creature would die from an attack affected by Unending darkness, you can spend a reaction to cause a Void to appear on the creature instead. A void appears. Creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Fortitude Saving throw upon its appearance. On a failed save the creature takes 6d10 force damage and is pulled in a straight line toward The Void, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible (even if that space is in the air). On a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. The creature whom The void started on automatically fails this save. The void lasts for 1 round. Any time a creature would be killed by this effect it increases its duration by a round to a maximum of your Wisdom Modifier.
Once you use this trait you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

fields.name: Destructive Force
fields.description:
you can surge with might and destructive force to enhance your attacks. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to make the attack deal an extra 1d4 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon attack.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Additionally, the damage of this feature scales up with your cleric level. It becomes 1d6 at level 6, 1d8 at level 12, and 1d10 at level 18.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Demolition
fields.description: When you use channel divinity, touch an object or creature. It must make a fortitude saving throw. On a success they take 4 times your cleric level in thunder damage, or half as much on a success. Critical failures or on static objects take 5 timesimes your cleric level instead. A creature’s body explodesd into a mist of gore and require a resurrection spell while objects are destroyed

fields.name: Unrelenting Destruction
fields.description: If you damage an enemy that you damaged in the previous turn, you do extra 1D6 thunder damage

fields.name: Destructive Aura
fields.description: Within 15 feet and yourself, you project an aura that reduces the armor value by up to your wisdom modifier (your choice)  including yourself. You can turn it on and off only after a short rest.

fields.name: Sundering Force
fields.description: after a short rest, select one type of damage type, you ignore resistance to that type of damage and immunity becomes resistance.

fields.name: Hand of Desolation
fields.description:
Your demolition channel divinity reduces non-magical objects and creatures to dust as if hit by a disintegrate spell,  requiring true resurrection to revivify.  You also can change thunder damage from your channel divinity to fire, lightning, force and explosion
You also learn the disintegrate spell which is always prepared and counts as a cleric spell

fields.name: Stonespeaker
fields.description:
The power you command is infused with elemental earth. You can speak, read, and write Primordial. Knowing this language allows you to understand and be understood by those who speak its dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran
Additionally, you gain the Mold Earth cantrip if you don't already know it. For you, this cantrip counts as a cleric cantrip.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Stonewarden's Aegis
fields.description: Choose a number of creatures up to half your cleric level rounded up[ (a minimum of 1) within 30 feet of you. For 10 minutes the chosen creatures' armor increases by an amount equal to half your cleric spellcasting bonus rounded down (a minimummininum of 1). If a chosen creature is hit with an attack they instead take no damage and the shield crumbles, removing the bonus.

fields.name: Stone Shell
fields.description: you can  gather stone and earth around you or a creature of your choice within 30ft. The target gains temporary hit pointshitpoints equal to your cleric level plus your Wisdom modifier, which disappear at the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

fields.name: Earth Affinity
fields.description: your connection to Earth grants you new benefits. You have advantage on saves and checks to resist being pushed or knocked prone. Additionally, you ignore difficult terrain made of stone, earth, and sand.

fields.name: Soul of Earth
fields.description: Your earthly affinity grants you increased durability. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons. Additionally, you are immune to the Petrified condition.

fields.name: Localised Earthquake
fields.description: you can expend all uses of channel divinity. You create a localised tremor of 200x200ft, creatures inside except you must make a fortitude saving throw or be knocked prone. The player can make it up to a 7.0 magnitude earthquake as a choice.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Strands of Fate
fields.description:
When you take a short or long rest, you can expend one use of channel divinity to roll D6 equal to your cleric level/3 rounded up.

You keep the dice value and can expend the dice to re-roll a dice roll based on the value.  You lose all use when you take a short or long rest.


Dice
Type
1
Skill Check
2
Saving Throw
3
Death Saving Throw
4
Damage Roll
5
Attack Roll
6
Any D20 roll

fields.name: Ties That Bind
fields.description:
you can temporarily tie your fate to others. You can touch one object or creature and magically tie a strand of fate from yourself to it for 1 hour or until you use this feature again. An unwilling creature must succeed on a will saving throw against your spell save DC to resist this effect. While the target is bound to you and on the same plane of existence as you, you can sense the direction to the target’s location, and you know the direction of its movement if it is in motion.
In addition, once per turn when you cast a spell using a spell slot to deal damage or restore hit points to the target, roll a d6, and the target receives extra damage or healing, respectively, equal to the number rolled.
You can use this feature’s action a number of times equal to your charisma modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest

fields.name: Insightfull Strike
fields.description:
As an action  you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. Your magic grants you a brief vision of the target’s defenses. Until the end of your next turn, you gain one of the following effects of your choice:

The next time you make an attack roll against the target, roll a d6 and add the number rolled to the total.
The next time the target must make a saving throw against a spell you cast, the target must roll a d6 and subtract the number rolled from the saving throw.

fields.name: Fate Temper
fields.description: As a reaction, you can select a creature you can see or yourself. When they make a saving throw or skill check, you can make a success a critical success while a failure becomes a critical failure. You can do this equal to your wisdom modifier per long rest

fields.name: Twist of Fate
fields.description: You gain the ability to impose your fate upon others. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can force them to make a will saving throw against your spell save DC. If they fail the throw, the attack misses. If they succeed, they have disadvantage on the attack. You can do this a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once).

fields.name: Omens and Portents
fields.description: Select a creature, you learn a single enigmatic word connected to the creature's fate in that time frame. Fate is notoriously inscrutable, and the word isn't necessarily meant to be taken at face value, so the meaning is often clear only in hindsight. The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. If the creature's fate is too uncertain, or on a failed flat check, the spell yields the word “inconclusive.” Either way, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

fields.name: Blessing of the Forge
fields.description:
you gain the ability to imbue magic into a weapon or armor. At the end of a long rest, you can touch one nonmagical object that is a suit of armor or a simple or martial weapon. Until the end of your next long rest or until you die, the object becomes a magic item, granting a +1 bonus to armor if it's armor or a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls if it's a weapon.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Artisan's Blessing
fields.description:
You gain the ability to imbue magic into a weapon or armor. At the end of a long rest, you can touch one nonmagical object that is a suit of armor or a simple or martial weapon. Until the end of your next long rest or until you die, the object becomes a magic item, granting a +1 bonus to armor if it's armor or a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls if it's a weapon.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

fields.name: Soul of the Forge
fields.description:
You gain resistance to fire damage.
While wearing armor you gain a +1 to armor

fields.name: Potent Mending
fields.description: Your casting time for the mending cantrip is now one action instead of one minute. Additionally, you can use it to heal your Wisdom modifier + your cleric level's worth of hit points to a construct or a crafted object if it has more than 0 hit points at the time of casting

fields.name: Saint of Forge and Fire
fields.description:
your blessed affinity with fire and metal becomes more powerful:

You gain immunity to fire damage.
While wearing armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

fields.name: Blessings of Knowledge
fields.description: You learn two languages of your choice. You gain expert proficiency in any lore and arcana.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages
fields.description: as a channel divinity. as an action. You gain expert proficiency in any skill or tool for the next hour. If you are already expert, you gain a tier higher in proficiency

fields.name: Knowledge of Foes
fields.description: When you make a study check, you always make it with advantage, and you can ask the DM for either its exact HP, its exact ability scores, its exact saving throws or its abilities.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Read Thoughts
fields.description:
you can use your Channel Divinity to read a creature's thoughts. You can then use your access to the creature's mind to command it.
As an action, choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature must make a Will saving throw. If the creature succeeds on the saving throw, you can't use this feature on it again until you finish a long rest.
If the creature fails its save, you can read its surface thoughts (those foremost in its mind, reflecting its current emotions and what it is actively thinking about) when it is within 60 feet of you. This effect lasts for 1 minute.
During that time, you can use your action to end this effect and cast the Suggestion spell on the creature without expending a spell slot. The target automatically fails its saving throw against the spell.

fields.name: Mastery of Knowledge
fields.description: When you make an intelligence skill check, you are always considered an expert in it. You gain master proficiency in Arcana

fields.name: Study one foe
fields.description: You can spend a long rest describing an enemy you have encountered to your party. The next time you encounter them your party has +1 against attack rolls and saving throws against it. This can only be active against one enemy.

fields.name: Visions of the Past
fields.description:
You can call up visions of the past that relate to an object you hold or your immediate surroundings. You spend at least 1 minute in meditation and prayer, then receive dreamlike, shadowy glimpses of recent events. You can meditate in this way for a number of minutes equal to your Wisdom score and must maintain concentration during that time, as if you were casting a spell.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Object Reading. Holding an object as you meditate, you can see visions of the object's previous owner. After meditating for 1 minute, you learn how the owner acquired and lost the object, as well as the most recent significant event involving the object and that owner. If the object was owned by another creature in the recent past (within a number of days equal to your Wisdom score), you can spend 1 additional minute for each owner to learn the same information about that creature.

Area Reading. As you meditate, you see visions of recent events in your immediate vicinity (a room, street, tunnel, clearing, or the like, up to a 50-foot cube), going back a number of days equal to your Wisdom score. For each minute you meditate, you learn about one significant event, beginning with the most recent. Significant events typically involve powerful emotions, such as battles and betrayals, marriages and murders, births and funerals. However, they might also include more mundane events that are nevertheless important in your current situation.

fields.name: Disciple of Life
fields.description: You gain expert proficiency in medicine

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Life Bloom
fields.description: when you channel divinity, you can distribute hit points equal to your (cleric spellcasting score + your cleric level) x 2. You can target allies within 50 ft or yourself.

fields.name: Blessed Healer
fields.description: When you heal others with a spell, you yourself heal extra equal to the spell level + 1.

fields.name: Life Harbringer
fields.description: You heal an ally, you heal extra based on twice the spell level.  When you use a medicine kit or kill, you heal extra based on half your cleric spellcasting score

fields.name: Rebuke Death
fields.description: When you heal an ally, they immediately lose all failed death saving throws and lose the wounded conditions

fields.name: Masters of Life
fields.description: Whenever you heal, you take the maximum of the dice value

fields.name: Bonus Cantrip
fields.description: You gain the Light cantrip if you don't already know it. This cantrip doesn’t count against the number of cleric cantrips you know.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn
fields.description: You present your holy symbol, and any magical darkness within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Fortitude saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to 1D10 + cleric spellcasting score + cleric level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who fail are dazzled while critical failure causes blindness. This lastslast until the end of your next turn. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

fields.name: Warding Flare
fields.description:
You can interpose divine light between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you or an ally within 20ft  are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker before it hits or misses. An attacker that can't be blinded is immune to this feature.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

fields.name: Beacon of Light
fields.description: You emit a beacon of light as if the daylight spell surrounds you in a 15ft radius. You can turn this on and off as 2 actions

fields.name: Light of Courage
fields.description: Allies in the Radiance of the Dawn Channel divinity gain a +2 to will saving throws and are immune to frightened effects until the end of your next turn

fields.name: Corona of Light
fields.description: You can use your action to activate an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it using another action. You emit bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light 30 feet beyond that. Your enemies in the bright light have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell or effect that deals fire or radiant damage.

fields.name: Lawfull Mind
fields.description: You have advantage on saving throws made to charm or compel you

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Order’s Demand
fields.description: You present your holy symbol, and each creature of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must succeed on a will saving throw or be frightened  by you until the end of your next turn or until the charmed creature takes any damage. You can also cause any of the frightened creatures to drop what they are holding when they fail the saving throw.

fields.name: Voice of Authority
fields.description:
You can invoke the power of law to embolden an ally to attack. If you cast a spell with a spell slot of 1st level or higher and target an ally with the spell,you can spend an action so that ally can use their reaction immediately after the spell to make one weapon attack against a creature of your choice that you can see.
If the spell targets more than one ally, you choose the ally who can make the attack.

fields.name: Disciplined Resolved
fields.description: You can use your reaction to give your allies advantage on saving throws made to compel or charm them.

fields.name: Wrath of Order
fields.description: When you damage a creature that you had succeeded a will saving throw against, you do extra 1D8 damage of your damage type.

fields.name: I am the law
fields.description: You and your allies within 20ft always have advantage on will saving throws.

fields.name: Friends to all
fields.description:
You gain the Friends cantrip as a bonus cantrip if you don’t already know it.

You may also choose to hold your holy symbol and invoke your deity's name. For the next hour after, you can add your Wisdom modifier as well as your Charisma modifier to any Charisma ability checks. You regain the use of this ability after a long rest.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Charming Aura
fields.description:
You infuse your target with attraction, causing it to act friendlier toward you. The target attempts a Will save. It gains a +5 and advantage to this save if you or your allies recently threatened or were hostile to it.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.
Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charming touch, unless it succeeds an spellcraft check against your cleric DC +10

Failure: The target's attitude becomes friendly toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you. If you use a hostile action against the target, the spell ends. You can Dismiss the spell. After the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations. If it doesn't realize you charmed it, you could potentially convince it to continue being your friend via mundane means.
Critical Failure As failure, but the target is helpful

fields.name: Captivating Presence
fields.description:
whenever a creature sees you they must make a will saving throw. Once on a success they  permanently succeed.

 On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on any attacks it would make against you, as well as disadvantage on will saving throws. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature under this effect can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect early on a success. The saving throws it makes to end this effect are not made at disadvantage.

This doesdose not work against creatures the DM deem immune such as constructs, aberrations, essentially creatures with no semblance of human emotion

fields.name: Bonds of Companionship
fields.description:
You form powerful bonds with your allies that protect them from harm. When you finish a long or short rest, choose a number of allies equal to your Wisdom modifier. Each targeted creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your Cleric level. Any time a bonded ally makes an attack roll within 30 feet of you, you can as a reaction grant them advantage on the attack roll. You can also as a reaction grant them advantage on any saving throw against a mind-affecting spell or ability. The bond ends when you have granted them this advantage or when you finish a long or 
short rest.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Captivating Adoration
fields.description:
You become intensely entrancing, and creatures are distracted by you as long as they remain within the area. You can exclude any creatures you choose from the effects. If a creature is in the aura when you Cast a Spell or when it enters the aura for the first time, it must attempt a Will saving throw. If a creature leaves and reenters, it uses the results of its original save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 hour.
Success The creature is fascinated with you for its next action, then is temporarily immune for 1 hour.
Failure The creature is fascinated with you.
Critical Failure The creature is fascinated with you, and its attitude toward you improves by one step

fields.name: Light Up the Room
fields.description: Your presence becomes illuminating and a faint glow seems to cling to you wherever you go. As an action, you can shed bright light in a 30-foot radius centered on you and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This effect lasts for 10 minutes. Any ally that is standing within the 30 feet of bright light you shed has advantage on initiative rolls, Charisma checks, and Will lSaving throws. Whenever an allied creature rolls a die to regain hit points, they may reroll any 1s rolled and must take the second result. Any hostile creature that makes an attack roll against you while standing in the bright light, must make a Will saving throw or become charmed by you until this feature ends. Once you’ve used this feature, you can’t use it again until you have finished a long rest.

fields.name: Emboldening Bond
fields.description:
You can forge an empowering bond among people who are at peace with one another. As an action, you choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you (this can include yourself) equal to half your cleric spellcasting score. You create a magical bond among them for 10 minutes or until you use this feature again. While any bonded creature is within 30 feet of another, the creature can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw it makes. Each creature can add the d4 no more than once per turn.
You can use this feature once per hour

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Enforcer of Peace
fields.description:
You present your holy symbol, forcing all creatures of your choice within a 40-foot radius to make a Will saving throw.


On a failed save, a creature cannot take any actions that directly cause harm or apply negative effects to others until the end of its next turn. On a critical failure, this effect lasts for an additional turn. The effect ends early if the creature takes damage. If this happens, the creature immediately gains its turn back and one action 
On a successful save, a creature can act normally but suffers radiant damage equal to your cleric level if it deals damage before the end of its next turn.
On a critical success, the creature is unaffected by this feature.

fields.name: Peace Mediator
fields.description: You always add your wisdom modifier to Charm (Persuasion) Checks.

fields.name: Protective Bond
fields.description: The bond you forge between people helps them protect each other. When a creature affected by your Emboldening Bond feature is about to take damage, a second bonded creature within 30 feet of the first can use its reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the first creature. The second creature then takes all the damage instead.

fields.name: Sanctuary of Peace
fields.description: When you are not surprised, you are always countedr as having the Sanctuary spell casted on you.

fields.name: Avatar of Peace
fields.description: When a creature you have not attacked in the past 24 hour, it has disadvantage on attacks against you for 1 hour.

fields.name: Walking the line
fields.description: You can harness the contrasting powers of light and darkness. When you take radiant damage, you can use your reaction to deal psychic damage equal to 2d6 + your Wisdom modifier to the attacker. Similarly, when you take necrotic damage, you can use your reaction to deal radiant damage equal to 2d6 + your Wisdom modifier to the attacker.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Shadow’s Call
fields.description: When you use your channel divinity, you call upon shadows to appear up to an area of 10 feet radius. You can choose if this creates a lightly obscured or heavily obscured area. This effect lasts for one minute or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. In addition, you can use a action to move the shadow.

fields.name: Shade Strike
fields.description: When lightly or heavily obscured at the start of your turn or taking a surprise round. Your attacks and spells do additional damage equal to half your cleric level (round up)

fields.name: Shadow Master
fields.description:
When you use channel divinity, you can use one of the following to augment your shadow’s call channel divinity as a action. If you create heavily obscuring shadows, you may select as many creatures in the shadows to ignore disadvantages imposed by the terrain.


Illuminant Shadows:
You can replace the shadows you create with resplendent radiant lightning, this dispels all types of darkness including magically created. The area is considered to come under the effect of the light spell. You may select anyone in the area to gain advantage on will saving throws. Fiends, undead and demons in this area must make a will saving throw; on a failure, they gain disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

Withering Shadows:
You shadows take out dark necrotic force, all creatures who start their turn in the shadows take 1d8 necrotic damage. When a creature does an attack or casts a spell that does radiant damage, you may make them take half the damage they deal in necrotic damage.

fields.name: Light Amidst Darkness
fields.description: When in darkness, you may emit a bright light as an action as if you have the daylight spell. Enemies must make a fortitude saving throw or be blinded on a failure for one minurte. They may repeat the save at the end of their turn

fields.name: Agent of Subterfuge
fields.description: You may select targets up to your wisdom modifier.  They must make a will saving throw, else you can compel them to do one action. They cannot cast spells 5th level or higher if applicable and cannot harm themselves. You can do this once per long rest

fields.name: Blessing of Trickster
fields.description: You can use your action to touch a willing creature other than yourself to give it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

fields.name: Channel Divinity : Invoke Duplicity
fields.description: You create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet o f you. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet o f you. For the duration, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion’s space, but you must use your own senses. Additionally, when both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.

fields.name: Sudden Shift
fields.description: As a reaction after being missed by a melee attack, you may move up to 15 feet, conceal yourself if applicable and do not provoke opportunity attacks

fields.name: Divinity to vanish
fields.description: As an action you can make yourself invisible after using channel divinity. You become visible if you attack or cast a spell.

fields.name: Deceptive Spellcasting
fields.description: When you cast a spell you can ignore the Vocal and Focus components. You can use this a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all uses after a long rest. You can likewise pretend to cast another spell when you cast another. Observers only knows when the spell effect takes place.

fields.name: Improved Duplicity
fields.description: You can create up to four duplicates of yourself, instead of one, when you use Invoke Duplicity. As a action on your turn, you can move any number of them up to 30 feet, to a maximum range of 120 feet.

fields.name: Zealous Striker
fields.description: You can use your wisdom to replace strength or dexterity when rolling for hit rolls.

fields.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
fields.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike with supernatural accuracy. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +15 bonus to the roll.. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses. You also can use a reaction to assist a creature within 25 feet to gain this bonus

fields.name: Holy Strikes
fields.description: You can touch a creature as an action. They gain a +<your cleric level> to their next damage roll. You can do so equal to your wisdom modifier per long rest

fields.name: Divine Prowess
fields.description: You can select a martial mastery trait. Over a minute, you can grant it to yourself or touch an ally to grant them that trait for an hour. You can change which martial mastery feat over a short or long rest.

fields.name: Avatar of Battle
fields.description: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

fields.name: Heavenly Mantle
fields.description: Whenever you use a guided strike on an ally, you gain that bonus. In addition, apply that bonus on a successful attack to do that amount of radiant damage

fields.name: Martial Mastery
fields.description: You gain a martial mastery.

fields.name: Hero's Defiance
fields.description:
When attacked by an attack that would , you can trigger this ability as a reaction to an attack. 

You shout in defiance and are filled with a burst of healing. Just before applying the attack's damage, you recover 6d8+20 Hit Points. If this is enough to prevent the attack from bringing you to 0 Hit Points, you don't become unconscious or dying. Either way, cheating death is difficult, and you can't use hero's defiance again until you commune. Hero's defiance can't be used against effects with the death trait or that would leave no remains, such as disintegrate.

fields.name: Paladin Dedication
fields.description: You choose to dedicate yourself as a paladin to one of these ideals

fields.name: Crusader's Mantle
fields.description: (20 ft radius). You and allies’ melee or ranged weapon attacks deal extra damage equal to <paladin DC tier>D4 of your favored domain damage type. Against targets of your Crusade, this damage increases to 1d6.

fields.name: Cleric Spellcasting
fields.description:
The Cleric Spell table shows you how many spell you have and states the amount of cantrips known. You regain all cleric spell slots after a long rest

You can prepared wisdom + cleric_level of spell slots from the divine spell list after a long rest..

Your key ability is wisdom.

fields.saving_throw_failure: Speed becomes 0 until the end of their next turn
fields.saving_throw_critical_failure: Speed is 0, and they lose their reaction.
fields.name: Holy Commands
fields.description:
1.Steadfast Resolve: Allies gain advantage on saving throws to resist being knocked prone and become immune to fear for 1 minute.
2.Halt the Heretic: Up to 3 enemies must make a Will saving throw. Failure: Speed becomes 0 until the end of their next turn. Success: Speed is halved. Critical Failure: Speed is 0, and they lose their reaction.
3.Advance the Line: Up to 3 allies can use their reaction to move half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Divine Lance
fields.description: Spend 4 devoted points and use an action to imbue yourself with divine power. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a +5 to dodge, 15ft of movement advantage on your attacks. In addition your next melee attack does double your paladin level in damage of your domain favoured damage and ignored armor and resistance.

fields.name: Stand Tall
fields.description: As a reaction, when an ally within 30 feet fails a death saving throw, they regain 1 hit point and regain consciousness. You may immediately use Lay on Hands on that creature, ignoring normal range. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1) per long rest.

fields.name: At Any Cost
fields.description:
Spend 8 devoted points as an action to become a divine avatar for 1 minute. Gain resistance to all damage. Your attacks deal extra 1D12 damage of your favored domain type. You automatically apply a smite with every weapon attack at no additional cost. 

Against Crusade targets, you gain advantage on all saving throws and attack rolls. Allies within 30 feet gain temporary hit points equal to half your level at the start of their turns. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before using it again.

fields.name: Cleansing Fire
fields.description:
You eminate an aura of fire that burns those who are deemed unholy. Hostile creatures take damage at the end of their turn if they stand in your aura. The aura has a 15ft radius. They must make a reflex save or take <paladin level/2>D4 <your domain damage>. Creatures of the target of your purification take D6 instead. They must continuously make saves whenever they are in the zone. You can turn on and off this aura taking a minute to do so.
You can spend a divine point when they make a save, on a failure their speed is now reduced by half, on a crit failure, their speed is reduced to 0.

fields.saving_throw_success: half damage of paladin_level/2*D10 True damage
fields.name: Purifying flame
fields.description:
Spending 3 devoted points, you can ignite a apark of holy cleansing flames on a target. For all creature not under the target of purification, it gives them +3 on will saves intil the end of their next turn, it cures all diseases,corruption, blinded, charmed, dominated effect. If that effect has a DC to overcome, you use your paladin proficiency to roll against it, doing it with advantage if it comes from a target of purification source. 

Against a target of purification creature, they make a will save or take <your paladin level/2>D10 true damage or half as much your domain damage on a success, or none on a critical success. On a critical failure, they take the max dice value.

fields.saving_throw_failure: 4D10 <favoured domain damage>, -2 on attack and cannot cast spells with V
fields.saving_throw_critical_failure: 4D10 <domain damage>, disadvantage and -2 on attack and cannot cast spells with V,F
fields.name: Holy Censure
fields.description: You can create a 30ftx30ft square within 100ft. Those inside must make a will save. Target of purification gain the stun(1) efffect on both types of failure and take true damage on a crit failure

fields.name: Purging Will and Retribution
fields.description:
You are immune to poison and disease.
You can spend a divine point as an action to cause a deadly burst of energy against something who has targetted you or damaged you as a reaction.
They take your half your paladin level in your favourate domain damage.

fields.name: Cleansing Force
fields.description:
Your successful usage of devoted blessing abilities that apply damage apply eradicating force.

The target takes <your paladin level> of <your favored domain damage> at the start of its turn. A spell such as dispell magic can attempt to remove it against your DC. Any spell that removed negative effects can be used as long, attempting a check against your DC.
It ends in 1 minute.

Against your target of purifiication, it does additional damage equal to your charisma modifier per turn.

fields.name: Avenging Aura
fields.description: You emanate an aura of 15 feet. Allies who attack enemies who have attacked them or other allies in the aura gain a +2 to attack rolls.

fields.saving_throw_failure: lose 15ft of movement if they move closer to you
fields.name: Divine Vengeance
fields.description:
Vow of Enmity - For 2 devoted points, Select a creature you can see as an action, you gain +2 to attack rolls against it for the next minute. 
Abjure enemy - Force an enemy for 2 devoted points within 45ft you can see to make a will saving throw.
Crit Failure - Terrified of you
Failure - Frightened of you
Sucess - -15ft of movement if they move closer to you
Crit success nothing

fields.name: Relentless Avenger
fields.description: Landing a successful opportunity attack allows you immediately to move half your movement without provoking attack of opportunuty.

fields.name: Avenging Strike
fields.description: You can make a attack action against creatures who attack you or allies within your aura as a reaction. If you are not in range, you can move up to 5ft as part of the react

fields.name: Relentless Avenger
fields.description:
You and allies in the aura gain 10feet of movement. In addition, your smite attacks force enemy to make a will saving throw or suffer the frightened condition until they succeed a resave.
You always smite as if you have spend one devoted point higher against creatures that have damaged you or any allies in the aura in the past minute.

fields.name: Emissary of Peace
fields.description: You gain +1 to all checks related to the cessation of hostilities

fields.name: Glimpse of Redemption
fields.description:
You eminate an aura of 15ft. When someone in the aura damaged you or an ally. They must choose to repent, if they repent they are not affected. If they repent they do not make the attack. 

If they refuse, whatever damage they deal is reduced by 2 + your paladin level.

fields.name: Devoted Redemption
fields.description: You can spend a reaction and 3  devoted points to prevent some of the harm you or an ally would normally take and channel it into retributive energy. When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to magically halve that damage, as you conjure a temporary divine barrier around the target that absorbs some of the damage. Once in the next minute, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can add an amount of <you devoted> damage to that attack's damage roll equal to the amount of damage blocked by the barrier.

fields.name: Rebuking Fire
fields.description: Those who refuse your glimpse of redemption aura take <your domain damage> equal to your paladin DC proficiency tier.

fields.name: Exalted Redemption
fields.description:
Creatures who repent cannot do damage until the end of their next turn.
Creatures who refuse cause you and your allies in the aura to gain resistance to two types of damage of your choosing until the start of your next turn.

fields.name: Avatar of Peace
fields.description:
You become an avatar of peace, which gives you two benefits:

You have resistance to all damage dealt by other creatures (their attacks, spells, and other effects).
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, it takes <your domain favored>damage equal to half the damage you take from the attack.

If you attack a creature, cast a spell on it, or deal damage to it by any means but this feature, neither benefit works against that creature until you finish a long rest.

fields.name: Designated protector.
fields.description: You can select a single person, object or area to be a designated protector for. You can change this after a commute

fields.name: Aura of Warding
fields.description: You create an aura of 15ft, allies within it can reduce incoming damage equal to your Paladin level once per turn. Your designated protector(or related)is considered to be in your aura as long as he is in twice your aura range.

fields.name: Holy Protector
fields.description:
Allegiance - You can spend one devoted point as a reaction when an ally within 30ft takes damage. They take half damage, and you take the other half.

Divine Bulwark(2 Action) - You can spend two devoted points to enhance your aura.  Those in your Aura gains disadvantage on attacks against targets in your aura that is not you

Turn the Tide - As an action and 2 devoted points You can give everyone in your aura temporary hit points equal to your paladin level. The person you are protecting gai

fields.name: Greater Aura
fields.description: Your aura increases to 25 feet and you can spend a devoted point to reduce the damage taken by 10 for a devoted point until the start of your next turn as a reaction or action.

fields.name: Unyielding Spirit
fields.description: As long as there is allies in your aura, you gain advantage on saving throws against all saving throws that afflict negative conditions on you.

fields.name: Undying Guardian
fields.description: All allies in your aura have advantage on death saving throws, resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage. They also gain a +2 bonus to armor and will saving throws.

fields.name: Fierce Demeanour
fields.description: You gain a +1 on intimidation checks

fields.name: Iron Command
fields.description:
